newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Thai woman jailed in Malaysia on drug charges.
newsitem.headline: Thai woman jailed in Malaysia on drug charges.

text.p: A Malaysian court on Sunday sentenced a Thai widow to 10 years in prison for possessing 3.8 kg (8.3 pounds) of cannabis, the national Bernama news agency reported.
The High Court in the northestern town of Kota Baru sentenced Seyak Awang, 29, to the prision term after she pleaded guilty to the amended charge of possession of drugs.
Seyak was originally charged with trafficking which carries the mandatory death sentence on conviction.
She was caught carrying cannabis in the Malaysian border town of Rantau Panjang in Kelantan state in July 1994.
Defence counsel Aziz Derashid told the court that Seyak was hard pressed as she had to look after her four children after the death of her husband.
He said that she was only paid to act as a courier so that she could buy milk for her baby.
